name: Holo Business
description: Tiron and AGIMUS have teamed up for a joint holosuite business venture to either outsell Quark or take over the galaxy, depending on which business partner you ask! Find out what they're up to and put a stop to any intergalactic machinations.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Krem, AGIMUS, Tiron, Shran, Weyoun, Penk, Brunt, or Scoundrels will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Krem, AGIMUS, Tiron, Shran, Weyoun, Penk, Brunt, or Scoundrels
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Bashir
featured_crew.flavor: Bashir had no problems with sharing his body for the zhian'tara ritual. But he won't be happy when he finds out what Torias did with it.

action.name: Life Is Too Short To Deprive Yourself Of The Simple Pleasures

featured_crew.name: Tiron
featured_crew.flavor: Tiron gives Quark generous financial incentive to get him a 'custom' holosuite program featuring Major Kira.

featured_crew.name: Shran
featured_crew.flavor: Shran calls in a favor to rescue his daughter being held for ransom.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Mulkahey
rewards.flavor: In one of Sisko's visions, Mulkahey was a plainclothes police officer in 1950’s New York who abused his power to harass Benny Russell.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Krem
rewards.flavor: Krem is not the smartest of the pirate crew, and his Ferengi lobes don’t help when it comes to Archer's manipulation tactics.

action.name: I Don't The Have Lobes For Business

rewards.flavor: Bashir had no problems with sharing his body for the zhian'tara ritual. But he won't be happy when he finds out what Torias did with it.

action.name: Life Is Too Short To Deprive Yourself Of The Simple Pleasures

rewards.name: Shran
rewards.flavor: Shran calls in a favor to rescue his daughter being held for ransom.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

screens.text: "I've never cared for holosuites and this mission is only intensifying my loathing. I've been tracking the supercomputer AGIMUS following its escape from Daystrom. It appears AGIMUS has found itself another fool to do its bidding. A Serilian by the name of Tiron."

"Somehow, AGIMUS convinced this Tiron to use holosuites to abduct wealthy would-be patrons and hold them for ransom. Now we have distress calls from several of our allies and could use your help freeing the hostages. Just try not to get caught up in AGIMUS' nonsense."

"I've never cared for holosuites and this mission is only intensifying my loathing. I've been tracking the supercomputer AGIMUS following its escape from Daystrom. It appears AGIMUS has found itself another fool to do its bidding. A Serilian by the name of Tiron."

"Somehow, AGIMUS convinced this Tiron to use holosuites to abduct wealthy would-be patrons and hold them for ransom. Now we have distress calls from several of our allies and could use your help freeing the hostages. Just try not to get caught up in AGIMUS' nonsense."
"Thanks for the rescue, Captain. I tell ya, you go off to do a little market resear-- I mean, take a little break, and you get kidnapped. Now, if you could just give me a lift to Deep Space Nine..."
"You might want to belay that request, Captain. I believe you will find Deep Space Nine less than receptive to any guests at the moment. Not that it's exactly receptive to its inhabitants either."

responses.text: "What do you want with Deep Space Nine?"
"Do you two really expect to get away with this?"
"This isn't going to earn you a date with Major Kira, Tiron."

screens.text: "Those bar holosuites were so easy to hack into, a rotary phone could do it. And who was the fool who hooked them right into the station's main computer. Now I'm in control of Deep Space Nine!"
"Good question. How much do you think your Starfleet command would pay for the return of their space station and all of their personnel, Captain?"
"But we have! Today, Deep Space Nine. Tomorrow, the Dominion. And then, the galaxy itself will kneel before us!"
"I-I don't know what you mean. This is purely business. And if my business acumen just happens to attract the interests of a certain Bajoran major, well, that's just a bonus, now isn't it?"
"As you can see, we can use your help here on Deep Space Nine, Captain. Please hurry. I can't take another word from these fools."
"Thanks for the rescue, Captain. I tell ya, you go off to do a little market resear-- I mean, take a little break, and you get kidnapped. Now, if you could just give me a lift to Deep Space Nine..."
"You might want to belay that request, Captain. I believe you will find Deep Space Nine less than receptive to any guests at the moment. Not that it's exactly receptive to its inhabitants either."

responses.text: "What do you want with Deep Space Nine?"
"Do you two really expect to get away with this?"
"This isn't going to earn you a date with Major Kira, Tiron."

screens.text: "Those bar holosuites were so easy to hack into, a rotary phone could do it. And who was the fool who hooked them right into the station's main computer. Now I'm in control of Deep Space Nine!"
"Good question. How much do you think your Starfleet command would pay for the return of their space station and all of their personnel, Captain?"
"But we have! Today, Deep Space Nine. Tomorrow, the Dominion. And then, the galaxy itself will kneel before us!"
"I-I don't know what you mean. This is purely business. And if my business acumen just happens to attract the interests of a certain Bajoran major, well, that's just a bonus, now isn't it?"
"As you can see, we can use your help here on Deep Space Nine, Captain. Please hurry. I can't take another word from these fools."
